result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael C. Peaslee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances/alcohol except prescribed medications taken as prescribed;
good faith effort at fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week;

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael C. Peaslee

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:59 am 
INCLUDES 22CF43 AND 22CF44. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person with Atty Natasha VanLieshout. 
State moves to: 
In 22CF43: Cts. 2 & 3>>>D&RI. 
In 22CF44: Ct. 2>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 22CF43: Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 22CF44: Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 3 years probation - CONDITIONS: AODA unless deemed not necessary by agent; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances/alcohol except prescribed medications taken as prescribed; good faith effort at fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; CC including DNA surcharges (sample already on file). 
COURT finds the def entitled to 2 days jail credit in both files if revoked. 
Adj: 10:08 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 26, 2022 at 09:50 am.
